EmailTemplate.textOnly:
SpringOne 2GX 2014 Sept 8-11, 2014 Save the Date and Call for Papers Open!
SUBMIT A PAPER NOW <http://springone2gx.com/home/speaker_request>
The CFP closes April 30th, 2014.
Pivotal <http://www.gopivotal.com/>, in conjunction with the No Fluff Just Stuff Symposium Series, is pleased to present SpringOne 2GX <http://www.springone2gx.com/>, the premier Java event of 2014. The SpringOne 2GX conference covers the entire Spring ecosystem as well as Groovy, Grails, Big Data and the Cloud. The conference will be held in Dallas, TX, September 8-11, 2014 at the Omni Dallas Hotel.
Omni Dallas Hotel 555 S. Lamar Street Dallas, Texas 75202 [map <https://www.google.com/maps/place/Omni+Dallas+Hotel/@32.7756028,-96.8040468,17z/>] (214) 744-6664
This is a one-of-a-kind conference for application developers, solution and data architects who develop business applications, create multi-device aware web applications, process vast quantities of enterprise data, design cloud architectures, and manage high performance infrastructure. The sessions are specifically tailored for developers using the hugely popular open source Spring IO Projects, Groovy & Grails, Cloud Foundry, Hadoop and Tomcat technologies. Whether you're building mission-critical web or business applications, crunching huge amounts of distributed data, or designing the next killer cloud application, SpringOne 2GX will keep you up to date with the latest enterprise technology.
Featuring presentations delivered by development leads, committers, and published authors, it's the ideal place to obtain critical skills to help you design, build and run tomorrow's software solutions. Plus you'll meet and learn from open source leaders <http://www.springone2gx.com/presenters> who drive innovation for these technologies.
New this year! Pivotal Education Services will also be offering immersion training Sept 7-8, on Spring, Cloud Foundry, and Hadoop for $200.00 USD, as a special offer to full conference attendees.
Check our website <http://www.springone2gx.com/> for speaker and session updates, and mark your calendar now! See you there,
